Curry Memorial]] }} '''Joshua Farris''' (born January 6, 1995) is an [[Americans|American]] [[Figure skating|figure skater]]. He has won [[United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. National]] titles on the juvenile (2006), intermediate (2008) and novice level ([[2009 United States Figure Skating Championships|2009]]). He is also the [[2010 United States Figure Skating Championships|2010 U.S. National Junior silver medalist]] and [[2010â2011 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2010 JGP J. Curry Memorial gold medalist]]. ==Career== === Early years === Farris began skating at age 6 after his mom took him skating for his birthday. He moved to [[Colorado Springs, Colorado]] in mid-2007 to train with [[Tom Zakrajsek]] and Becky Calvin. Farris won his third national title when he took the novice gold at the [[2009 United States Figure Skating Championships|2009 U.S. Championships]]. He was then sent to the [[2009 International Challenge Cup]] in [[The Hague]], [[Netherlands]] where he took silver on the junior level. He made his [[2009â2010 ISU Junior Grand Prix|ISU Junior Grand Prix]] debut in the following season. He was assigned to the [[2009â2010 ISU Junior Grand Prix]] events in [[USA]] and [[Turkey]] where he placed 4th and 5th, respectively. At the [[2010 United States Figure Skating Championships|2010 U.S. Championships]], he took silver on the junior level. === 2010â2011 season === In the 2010â2011 season, Farris was assigned the [[2010â2011 ISU Junior Grand Prix|Junior Grand Prix]] events in [[Romania]] and [[Great Britain]] where he took silver and gold, respectively. This qualified him for the [[2010â2011 Grand Prix of Figure Skating Final|2010-2011 Junior Grand Prix Final]] where he placed 6th. Farris decided to move up to the senior level nationally. At the [[2011 United States Figure Skating Championships|2011 U.S. Championships]], Farris fell hard on his left hip when he trained a [[Quad (figure skating)|quad]] during the second day of practice. The fall resulted in a torn [[abductor muscle]], but despite the pain he still decided to compete. He placed 13th after a shaky [[Short program (figure skating)|short program]]. On the day between the short and long programs Farris went to a restaurant and had an [[anaphylactic shock]] due to his [[Dairy allergy|severe allergy to dairy products]]. He was rushed to the emergency room where he stayed until 3 a.m. He decided to compete his long program where he had several shaky landings and three falls. He placed 21st in the free skate and overall. It later turned out that he had broken his [[fibula]] and sprained a [[tendon]] when he fell on his second [[Axel jump|triple axel]] attempt. Following this competition, Farris decided to change coaches to [[Christy Krall]], with whom he had already worked, and [[Damon Allen (figure skater)|Damon Allen]]. === 2011â2012 season === In the [[2011â2012 figure skating season|2011â2012 season]], Farris was assigned to a [[2011â12 ISU Junior Grand Prix|Junior Grand Prix]] event in [[Gdansk]], [[Poland]]. He won the event. == Personal life == Farris is home-schooled. His older brother, David, is a bowler. He becomes sick even if something has touched milk so he travels with a whole suitcase of food. == Programs == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Season ! Short program !
